title: Convert VibeReel web app to mobile-first app experience

requirements.text: Redesign the overall layout to a mobile-first, app-like experience: constrain the max width to a phone-sized viewport (max-w-sm or ~390px) centered on desktop, remove the top header navigation bar and replace it with a bottom tab bar (Home, Explore, Upload, Profile) styled like a native mobile app tab bar with icons and labels.
acceptanceCriteria: The app renders in a centered, phone-width container (≤390px wide) on desktop screens
A persistent bottom tab bar replaces the top header for primary navigation
Bottom tab bar has four tabs: Home, Explore, Upload, and Profile, each with an icon and label
Active tab is visually highlighted
The top header bar is removed or reduced to a minimal branding-only strip

requirements.text: Update the TikTok-style vertical video feed (HomePage) to fill the full mobile viewport height using 100dvh per card, with touch-friendly swipe scroll-snap behavior that mimics native mobile short-video apps.
acceptanceCriteria: Each video card occupies exactly 100dvh height within the phone-width container
Scroll-snap is set to mandatory with y-axis snapping
Swiping up/down smoothly transitions between videos
Video auto-play and pause-on-scroll-out behavior is preserved

requirements.text: Convert the Upload page to a mobile-native-style full-screen sheet: use a large tap target for file selection, full-width inputs, and a prominent upload CTA button styled for touch interaction. Fix the video upload flow so that file selection, validation, chunked upload, and success/error feedback all work correctly end-to-end.

quotes: He is not working please convert web to App

acceptanceCriteria: File picker opens on tap of a large, clearly labeled area
Title and description inputs are full-width and touch-friendly
Upload button is prominent and disabled while upload is in progress
Upload progress bar is visible during chunked upload
Success and error states are clearly communicated via toast or inline message
A video file can be selected, titled, described, and successfully uploaded to the backend without errors

requirements.text: Update the comments panel to render as a native-style bottom drawer/sheet that slides up from the bottom of the phone-width container, with a drag handle, backdrop dimming, and a fixed comment input pinned above the keyboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Comments panel slides up from the bottom with a smooth animation
A visible drag handle is shown at the top of the panel
A semi-transparent backdrop dims the video behind the panel
The comment input field is pinned to the bottom of the panel
The panel can be dismissed by tapping the backdrop or swiping down

requirements.text: Update the Profile and Explore pages to use full-width, mobile-optimized layouts: full-width profile header, stacked stats row, and a 2-column video grid that fills the phone-width container without horizontal overflow.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile header spans full width with avatar, username, bio, and stats in a mobile-friendly stacked layout
Video grid on Profile and Explore pages uses exactly 2 columns within the phone-width container
No horizontal scrollbar or overflow appears at any viewport size
All touch targets (buttons, grid items) are at least 44×44px

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
All Motoko logic must remain in backend/main.mo
Preserve all existing features: authentication, video feed, upload, profiles, explore, comments, likes, and follows
nonGoals: Publishing to Apple App Store or Google Play Store
Converting to React Native or any native mobile framework
Adding new backend features or data models beyond fixing the upload flow
Changing the Internet Identity authentication mechanism
